description: Dozens have drowned trying to cross the river to EU-member Romania. Border guards are trying to stop them, as the Ukrainian military pushes mass conscription to address troop shortages.
title: On a river between Ukraine and the EU, border guards search for draft evaders

description: A team of independent famine experts, working under the U.N. umbrella, believe Sudan is experiencing famine. But issuing a declaration — which could bring in more aid — turns out to be complicated.
title: Yes there is famine in Sudan. So why isn't 'famine' being declared?

description: Shanahan, a wealthy California attorney and Kennedy’s running mate, made the comments on a podcast episode posted Tuesday.
title: Nicole Shanahan says she and RFK Jr. may drop out and endorse Trump

description: A preliminary report from the Labor Department shows U.S. employers added 818,000 fewer jobs in the year ending in March than initially reported.  The news comes during an election season in which the strength of the economy is a key issue for voters.
title: U.S. added fewer jobs in the past year than initially reported

description: A federal judge in Texas has struck down the government's ban on noncompetes. An estimated 30 million U.S. workers are subject to the employment agreements.
title: Federal judge throws out U.S. ban on noncompetes

description: Investigative reporter David Rohde says that since 2016, Trump has used conspiracy theories, co-option and threats to undermine federal law enforcement. His new book is Where Tyranny Begins.
title: How Trump bent the Justice Department and FBI to his will

description: Tim Walz is the main event, but former President Bill Clinton, former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg are also speaking in Chicago on Wednesday.
title: Here’s who’s speaking on Day 3 of the DNC

description: The search continued for one more missing passenger on a yacht that sank off Sicily and questions intensified about why the vessel went down so quickly when a nearby sailboat remained largely unscathed.
title: Divers find 5 bodies during search of yacht wreckage off Sicily

description: The Obamas headlined DNC night two, challenging America to make history by electing the first woman to the White House. And, a final report released on what led to Maine's deadliest mass shooting.
title: The Obamas challenge America. And, what led up to Maine's deadliest mass shooting

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to former Deputy Assistant Defense Secretary Evelyn Farkas, now at the McCain Institute, about Ukraine's incursion into Russia, and implications for U.S. and allied policy.
title: what does Ukraine’s incursion into Russia say about a so-called 'red line'?

description: Michelle Obama urged Democrats to do all they can to win. Barack Obama asked delegates to “listen” to voters who aren’t ready yet. VP nominee Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz addresses the DNC Wednesday night.
title: The Obamas use their speeches to the Democratic National Convention to excite voters

description: Chicago is home to the largest population of Palestinian Americans. How is this community feeling about having the DNC in town and are they optimistic the event will amplify their concerns?
title: Palestinian Americans in Chicago use DNC to demand an end to the war in Gaza

description: The Minnesota governor speaks at the DNC in Chicago on Wednesday. Walz has gone from a relatively unknown politician to accepting the Democratic nomination for vice president in two short weeks.
title: 5 things to know about Tim Walz, Democratic vice presidential nominee

description: Mountains, the first feature by filmmaker Monica Sorelle, focuses on a Haitian American family struggling to get ahead in a South Florida neighborhood targeted by developers.
title: Miami’s Little Haiti neighborhood is on borrowed time. A film is documenting it all

description: Is the "Blue Wall" of states that usually vote Democratic still strong? NPR's Steve Inskeep asks senior editor at "The Atlantic," Ron Brownstein, the writer who coined the term.
title: Are Pennsylvania, Wisconsin and Michigan now the weak link in the Blue Wall?

description: While Democrats hold their convention in Chicago, former President Donald Trump is traveling across the country hoping to get his message across to voters as to why they should choose him in November.
title: Trump travels to battleground states as Democrats gather in Chicago for DNC

description: It was Ronald Reagan who started the trend of using pop songs. Chris Willman, the chief music critic at Variety, gives a short history of 200 years of campaign music.
title: The history of presidential campaign songs goes back to George Washington

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Wired reporter, Makena Kelly, about how influencers are making waves at this year's Democratic National Convention.
title: For the first time, political influencers have press credentials at the DNC

description: Local law enforcement and the U.S. Army Reserves might have thwarted a mass shooting in Lewiston, Maine. A commission says the killer showed signs that could have put him in protective custody.
title: The final report is out in an investigation into Maine's deadliest mass shooting

description: A wave of illnesses is bringing scrutiny to a murky marketplace of mushroom gummies and candy. But is a popular red-capped fungus really to blame? Testing shows there's more going on
title: Mushroom edibles are making people sick. Scientists still don't know why

description: Derek Chauvin was moved to a prison in Texas months after he was stabbed in a different facility. Meanwhile, another former Minneapolis officer, Thomas Lane, was released from prison in Colorado.
title: Ex-officer convicted in George Floyd's killing is moved to new prison

description: Special tracks for each state and territory were played during Tuesday night's DNC roll call. But what song repped your state? We found them all so you don't have to.
title: The DNC roll call featured a musical salute to each state. Here's what your state chose

description: Night 2 of the Democratic National Convention is a wrap. The program featured more Democratic heavy-hitters (and a couple of Republicans) who sought to promote a message of hope while also sharpening attacks against Donald Trump.
title: Who spoke at the DNC: Watch speeches from the Obamas, Bernie Sanders and Doug Emhoff

description: Obama sought to draw a parallel between Vice President Kamala Harris’ story and his own, saying “this convention has always been pretty good to kids with funny names who believe in a country where anything is possible.”
title: WATCH: Former President Barack Obama's full remarks to the Democratic National Convention

description: Former first lady Michelle Obama received some of the loudest cheers of the night in Chicago as she told the excited crowd, "Hope is making a comeback!"
title: In her DNC remarks, Michelle Obama jabs Trump over his claim about 'Black jobs'

description: Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker made an unusual move for a Democrat — touting his billionaire status from the convention stage, as a jab at former President Trump.
title: Two takes on billionaires at the DNC

description: New Mexico’s Democratic governor, Michelle Lujan Grisham, who previously served as the state’s health secretary before getting elected to Congress, spoke at the DNC tonight on the topic of health care.
title: New Mexico Gov. Lujan Grisham talks health care in DNC remarks

description: Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders' list of economic policies received a welcome reception from the crowd at United Center, but it was his call for an end to the war in Gaza that received a big response from the audience.
title: Sen. Bernie Sanders calls for a Gaza ceasefire

description: Delegates to the Democratic National Convention held a ceremonial — and celebratory — roll call vote to mark Vice President Kamala Harris’ selection as the party’s presidential nominee.
title: WATCH: The full Democratic National Convention celebratory roll call

description: Following the Dobbs decision in 2022, states have enacted various levels of abortion restrictions — confusing doctors and patients. A number of states have the abortion question on the ballot for November — including key battlegrounds like Arizona and Nevada
title: Reproductive health is a major topic at the DNC. Here's the current state of abortion laws

description: Kate Cox, a Texas woman who sued her state when she was denied an abortion there, announced that she is pregnant during the DNC’s delegate roll call.
title: Kate Cox, Texas woman denied an abortion, announces she's pregnant again
